question:
TASK 1
You recently received a letter from a friend asking for advice about whether to go to college or to try to get a job. You think he/she should get a job.
•	Say why he/she would not enjoy going to college
•	Explain why getting a job is a good idea for him/her
•	Suggest types of job that would be suitable for him/her
text: Hello Jessica, hope you and your parents are well. I am writing a reply to your letter with few suggestions regarding you asked for. It may help you to decide whether to do a work or continue with your college. In my opinion, you should join a work of your interest.

Firstly, you want to do a master in literature. Therefore, you enrolled in one of the famous Arts College. But, when you visited a college campus, it comes to your notice that there is not an academic environment. Moreover, all students are coming to having fun and are doing parties besides study. It happens because they think that to get an admission here is tough rather than to graduate from here. These all matter bother you and you are not  willing to study any more. In addition, the fee of the college is huge amount and you cannot afford to waste it.

Therefore, you should apply for a job and achieve your desire goal. It is the best way to make your dream come true and most valuable thing is an experience. You will get experience of dealing with different age group people. Moreover, you will get knowledge about professional as well as social also.

Finally, I suggest you to try a job in your area of interest like music composer or music teacher.  As, it is your dream to be a musician. In my point of view, you should contact well-known drama group and music agency to serve your intelligence. You should also do a job as music teacher in any respected school.
I hope you will get a career definitely as per your ability. If you need any help then feel free to call. Take your own time to finalise your decision wisely.
